intro: Hieracium subulare, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are narrow and pointed, and it produces yellow flowers in clusters. Hieracium subulare is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it thrives in full sun.
